line.comment: * play sample 924
* Short description of the menu, matches the *.SM version's varaible of the same name.
* The settings variable remembers all the things that should be remembered between page refreshes, and between menu openings
* Here, you can initialize the "remembered menu settings" values that should NOT be remembered.
* It is like unremembering a setting, and there's reasons to do that sometimes
* They should be set right before the SM menu is called.
* i.e. that should be reset everytime the menu is loaded example:
* $Settings[1] = null
* set global variable: name=$Key.Settings value=$Settings
* Run the SM menu once to set the menu, before we start the callback loop.
* Key Menu: The menu pointer (array) for the menu used
* Key.Settings: Hold all the ui control settings that are remembered between menus. For example, the currently selected value of a switch
* First, optionally used flag in the SM script. On the first run, the script can call the menu writing, but not call the menu writing in subsequent calls UNLESS callback is called (which means
* the user has hit a control)
* Args can be passed to the callback. The args are passed *after* the $Callbackreturn
* So in this example, this array will pass [THIS] to the SM scripts 6th argument on (which is $This in the SM script)
* Note these are not dynamic, so only pass values that would remain static, and use the menu passthrough for dynamic values
* $Ret = $Ret[0]
* gosub BuildReturnArray:
* Display static menu when no articles available for current sector's owner
* Select random static news channel, and get available tags
* Get a random article for each tag in the channel
* is article already selected?
* is race allowed?
* get string of races, needed for customization
* check, if an article is a duplicate or race doesn´t match
* Race doesn´t fit or article is already in another Channel tag
* get available Channels for a given race
* $PageID.Array = get global variable: name='GNS.PageID.Array'
* If dynamic news article has an action script but no action button set, run the script once; if article is flagged for One-Time Display, remove it now
* If action script is set
* but no button defined
* Initialize Executed Scripts array, if needed
* See if action script has already been executed
* If not, then flag article to be added to array and execute the script
* If article is flagged for one-time display, then remove it
* If article is flagged to be removed and we aren't deleting it right now, add to ScriptsExecuted array
* Remove expired Dynamic News articles
* If article has expired
* Check if article is in ScriptsExec array
* If so, remove from array

sval.val: Menu: GNS Sow News Channel
play sample 924
Short description of the menu, matches the *.SM version's varaible of the same name.
The settings variable remembers all the things that should be remembered between page refreshes, and between menu openings
Here, you can initialize the "remembered menu settings" values that should NOT be remembered.
It is like unremembering a setting, and there's reasons to do that sometimes
They should be set right before the SM menu is called.
i.e. that should be reset everytime the menu is loaded example:
$Settings[1] = null
set global variable: name=$Key.Settings value=$Settings
Run the SM menu once to set the menu, before we start the callback loop.
Key Menu: The menu pointer (array) for the menu used
Key.Settings: Hold all the ui control settings that are remembered between menus. For example, the currently selected value of a switch
First, optionally used flag in the SM script. On the first run, the script can call the menu writing, but not call the menu writing in subsequent calls UNLESS callback is called (which means
the user has hit a control)
Args can be passed to the callback. The args are passed *after* the $Callbackreturn
So in this example, this array will pass [THIS] to the SM scripts 6th argument on (which is $This in the SM script)
Note these are not dynamic, so only pass values that would remain static, and use the menu passthrough for dynamic values
$Ret = $Ret[0]
gosub BuildReturnArray:
Display static menu when no articles available for current sector's owner
Select random static news channel, and get available tags
Get a random article for each tag in the channel
is article already selected?
is race allowed?
get string of races, needed for customization
check, if an article is a duplicate or race doesn´t match
Race doesn´t fit or article is already in another Channel tag
get available Channels for a given race
$PageID.Array = get global variable: name='GNS.PageID.Array'
If dynamic news article has an action script but no action button set, run the script once; if article is flagged for One-Time Display, remove it now
If action script is set
but no button defined
Initialize Executed Scripts array, if needed
See if action script has already been executed
If not, then flag article to be added to array and execute the script
If article is flagged for one-time display, then remove it
If article is flagged to be removed and we aren't deleting it right now, add to ScriptsExecuted array
Remove expired Dynamic News articles
If article has expired
Check if article is in ScriptsExec array
If so, remove from array
